channel.title: Steam, Good or Not good. (Sirious crisis)
channel.description:
Hey, i Want to buy my future skyrim and updates, Because i feel like its the right thing to do i play the game so much that i want to give the developers what they deserve.
So im planning to buy Skyrim, and the update Skyrim dawnguard. But if i buy them on steam i get an epic Creation Kit with it to Mod my skyrim.
The only thing that doesn't feel right, is that i dont get a disk of the games, its all virtual.... thats the thing that i don't like, i want to own the game. For example when i'm 30 and i come back from my job and i feel like i'm in an oldschool gaming mood, And i check my old games and i see skyrim and i think aaaah i used to eat this game!!!! But then i think hmmm, what game did i play, oww skyrim.... fuck can't find the disk.... ow damn i got it on hmmm stream, noo steam!
F*!ck forgot password on steam, gf.
And thats what is bugging me, I realy want to have it on disk so i can never lose it. But steam is easy and gives me a Creation kit + other cool and easy features.
What to do, what to do.

item.title: Steam, Good or Not good. (Sirious crisis)
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

t4:

steam is siriously good

Glad to see I’m not the only person that had a problem with that!

OT: Steam

I am 29…

haha no jk im 18, but i guess in 12 years there still be Cd players in Pc’s

item.title: Steam, Good or Not good. (Sirious crisis)
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

Frell:

Meh, not a huge worry. Steam will be around for a long time and you can easily switch computers with steam. I love steam.

Ye your right, big deal if im 30 and i have to buy skyrim again.
For now its way more easy, and i can simply swap from my pc to my laptop, + Get updates of skyrim.

Read full topic
